meanings.definition: A rhythmic pattern typically used in polka music.
meanings.sent1: The band played a lively oompahpah during the polka dance.
meanings.sent2: The oompahpah of the tuba set the tempo for the polka song.
meanings.sent3: The oompahpah rhythm made everyone want to dance.
meanings.sent4: The oompahpah echoed through the hall, filling it with energy.
meanings.sent5: The oompahpah beat was so catchy, it stayed in my head all day.

meanings.definition: The sound made by a tuba or other brass instrument playing in a marching band.
meanings.sent1: The oompahpah of the tuba resonated across the parade route.
meanings.sent2: The marching band's oompahpah added a festive atmosphere to the event.
meanings.sent3: The oompahpah music made the spectators cheer along.
meanings.sent4: The oompahpah filled the air, announcing the arrival of the parade.
meanings.sent5: The powerful oompahpah of the brass instruments was heard from afar.

meanings.definition: To play a repetitive bass line on a brass instrument.
meanings.sent1: He loves to oompahpah on his tuba whenever he gets the chance.
meanings.sent2: The musician oompahpahed skillfully during the performance.
meanings.sent3: She oompahpahed with such enthusiasm that the audience clapped along.
meanings.sent4: The oompahpahing added a rich depth to the band's music.
meanings.sent5: As he oompahpahed, the melody soared above the bass line.
